intro: Palmeria myriantha, commonly known as the velvetleaf palmeria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a dense layer of fine, velvety hairs. Its flowers are typically pink or purple and bloom in clusters, adding ornamental value to the plant. Palmeria myriantha thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
